name: KDP FLEXI BUNDLE PAK
description: Great deal on both volumes: -Original Flexi Drum Breaks Volume 1 -Original Flexi Drum Breaks Volume 2 As longtime record collectors of dusty kicks, hats and snares, it's quite evident that we are quite the drum-break-enthusiasts. I mean, our name says it all. That said, our goal for the KDP FLEXIDISK DRUM BREAKS series is to provide both dj's and or producers (or collectors of cool things) with a fresh, bold sound. *LIMITED 10 COPIES!

name: WALT SICKNIN' 12'' EP 001
description: NOW SHIPPING! KDP BASIC BLACK EP - limited black 12" vinyl EP (#201-300) - gold center label w/ black imprint - black jacket w/ metallic gold imprint + deboss - includes printed inner sleeve w/ liner notes - analog mastered / hand cut / pressed Last seen on the 300 block of 7th st. in Hunting Park, the infamous underground rapper known as Walt Sicknin’ has not contacted friends or relatives in over 3 weeks. Witnesses saw him leaving his North Philly residence around 7pm, smoking a cigarette of the menthol variety. He was wearing camouflage, baggy cargo pants, black Nikes, a KicDrum Products tee shirt, and a KicDrum Products Transformer five-panel hat. Walt was reportedly traveling by foot to Olney transportation center to head to his show. He never made his performance. The people from the neighborhood whisper that Walt’s disappearance could be the work of any number of foes. The manner in which Walt Sicknin’ often dispersed his competition left many thinking that some “crazy, weak-ass-rapper” would kidnap Walt and hold him ransom for the teachings of his secret style many years ago; though this fate appeared destined to elude Walt Sicknin’ until recently. Now the myth who’s legend floats through Philly streets like a ghost trapped between worlds is missing, and fear and disappointment grow both inside and outside of the community. The only evidence collected by inspectors, was a vinyl EP record, found just minutes from Olney Ave. and Broad St. Although the police have been generally mum on the contents of the record, sources have leaked that the material is the hardest rap music to come out of Philadelphia since the Tuff Crew. My sources have confirmed that the six track EP is scored by the Philly area underground conductors Drumz & Llingo and features a special, exclusive bonus track produced by the one and only DA BEATMINERZ. Walt drops a “treasure chest of gems on folk,” according to another person who has been privy to the records contents—which only makes investigators job more perilous, considering the “envy of his rap style makes every Philadelphia emcee/rapper an immediate suspect." This morning on the streets of North Philadelphia, children, adults and elderly, could be heard throughout the neighborhoods asking passers by, “where’s Walt yo?” Thus, the search has begun. If you or any one you know has any information regarding the whereabouts of Walt Sicknin’ please call 1-800-1SP-1200 or contact us directly at Kicdrumproducts.com VINYL EP TRACKLISTING / CREDITS: SIDE A 01- WALTRODUCTION hosted by LLINGO Produced by Drumat!c w/ SP-1200 02- THE SICKNESS Produced by Drumat!c w/ SP-1200 03- PHILLY WRECKIN' STUFF Produced by Llingo Apt w/ SP-1200 + Emax I 04- STORY MODE Produced by Drumat!c w/ SP-1200 05- THE SICKNESS A Capella# Vocal Only SIDE B 06- tXn RAP COMMANDMENTS Produced by Llingo Apt w/ SP-1200 07- WALT PIMPIN' Produced by Drumz & Llingo w/ SP-1200 08- WHERE'S WALT YO? Produced by Drumat!c w/ SP-1200 09- UNDATHERADAR# Produced by DA BEATMINERZ w/ SP-1200 + S900 10- tXn RAP COMMANDMENTS A Capella# Vocal Only All tracks written by Walt Sicknin' All production by Drumz & Llingo All cuts/scratches by Drumat!c Executive Produced by Lord Dio & Calv aka Beto Chavez *Except for Track 09- produced by Mr Walt & Dj Evil Dee Recorded and Mixed at D&D Studios, NY 1995 Mixed by Kieran Walsh & DA BEATMINERZ (w/ additional cuts/scratches + post production by Drumat!c) Recorded + Mixed by Drumz & Llingo at Bomb Shelter, PA Engineered + Mastered by John Fachet at Sweet Creek Studios, PA #Vinyl Exclusive [12" EP Format] Artwork subject to change/Delays may occur. *Ships out December 2013 ® 2013 KicDrum Products, LLC

name: SIGNATURE TIME 7” VINYL 004
description: NOW SHIPPING! There will be no ‘Boss’ talk here. The underside of the street has oozed from the depths that once contained it and it has refused to recede. The shadows cast upon the block by the glimmering structures that tower over the city’s heart have begun to consume its source. Slowly making its way to the top floors, the once undaunted executive attempts to flee before being swallowed up by the fervor that is consuming the base. Yet, he has nowhere to run, for he has already climbed the ladder to the top and now his journey can only lead down. Those who rise-up burn the ink dyed parchment that litters the desktops and sign their name in ashes mixed with blood and sweat. Prepare for “Signature Time”. Scored by the SP1200 Titan’s: Gensu Dean and Drumz & Llingo. KicDrum Products introduces their most recent 7’ series release, Signature Time (Tip it Back part II), the A-side produced by the Grand Imperial Gensu Dean--who's most recent work includes a long awaited link up with underground vet Planet Asia on their new Abrasions LP--on Mello Music Group. The incredibly hard and funky beat features the acrobatic flow and lyrical styling’s of Drumz & Llingo’s Llingo Apt and introduces a new talent to the KDP team, Baltimore’s verbal assassin Kenobi (the newest member of the KDP family). The triple threat of “Signature Time” is anchored by the “north Philly street mangler” himself, Walt Sicknin’ who’s microphone prowess electrifies the track and begs for a re-wind. The B-side “Chamber Crack” (Sewer Mix) produced by Drumz & Llingo is an extremely dirty, grimy track that feels like it was actually created and recorded under North Broad St., although we can’t be sure. Walt Sicknin’s original flow and unparalleled storytelling ability make “Chamber Crack” one of those tracks that remind you when hip-hop sounded like the blocks it came from. The modern day soundtrack to the North Philadelphia streets is being fleshed out right here on wax. This solo effort puts on notice all rappers who rep the street but whose product appeals to the club. Most will not be shaking their ass to “Chamber Crack”, they will be shaking in their boots. KicDrum Products continues to define the hard formidable sound long associated with underground hip-hop and Walt Sicknin's "Signature Time" B/W "Chamber Crack" only reinforces their ethic. A Side: SIGNATURE TIME featuring LLINGO APT and KENOBI produced by GENSU DEAN Recorded/Mixed by GENSU DEAN and JIMI BOWMAN at KLEARLIGHT STUDIOS (Dallas, TX) -- B Side: CHAMBER CRACK (SEWER MIX) produced by DRUMZ and LLINGO Recorded by DRUMZ and LLINGO Mixed by DRUMAT!C and LORD DIO Cuts/Scratches by DRUMAT!C Engineered and Mastered by John Fachet Silver Seven Series™ 300 Numbered, Limited Pressings 120 Burgundy Blood Red 180 Black Silver Metallic Ink 18pt. Black Paper Jacket 100% Recycled Ship Date: July 30th *Artwork subject to change.

name: KDP WINTER WOLF BEANIES
description:
As the fog hangs cumbersome above the ground, the wolf stalks with equanimity stealing steps without sound.  The summer sun has set only to make way for the rise of our luminous fall moon, KicDrum Products offers up its latest head wear to keep you warm on the streets: The KDP Winter Wolf Beanie, First Edition. 

He who makes himself a sheep will be eaten by wolves…

Custom sewn KDP STAY TRUE woven label
KDP classic tag sewn inside
Soft, Warm, and Thick
100% Acrylic
Approximately 11"-12" inches long
Hand Wash Only w/ Delicates
Hang Dry Only

MADE IN USA
(Third Run)

name: KDP TRNS4MR-SCRATCH 5 PANEL
description: NOW SHIPPING! Straight from Philly like the Transformer scratch itself, these five panel hats don’t convert into a Ferrari or jet but they will transform your confidence and style. The authentic hat of emcees, B-boys, DJ’s and writers everywhere because of its innate ability to enhance the wearer’s savoir-faire. KDP’s Transformer five panel paying homage to DJ’s in Philly and Worldwide. LIMITED EDITION 12 Units Only (Will never be reissued) Vintage 1980s Transfomers Fabric Silver Stitched Woven Label Ballistic Nylon Over Visor Adjustable Velcro Strap Custom Engraved KDP Badge *Each hat is unique and may not have characters on the front or side Unique fit and finish ONE SIZE FITS MOST

name: KDP FIVE EMCEE 5 PANEL
description: NOW SHIPPING! At KicDrum Products we pride ourselves in representing all of the five major elements of Hip Hop as outlined by Mr. KRS-ONE; Emceeing, DJing, B-Boying, Writing and Entrepreneurship collectively. We are the five elements and our products reflect our dedication to the art. Thus, we reveal our Voltron Beast King GoLion [百獣王ゴライオン] 5-Panel. Five panels, Five elements, uniting in unrivaled formation because…"KDP be the universal; the Biochemical; Arm, Leg, Leg, Arm, Head is the physical." LIMITED EDITION 12 Units Only (Will never be reissued) Vintage 1980s Voltron Fabric Ballistic Nylon Over Visor Silver Stitched Woven Label Adjustable Velcro Strap Custom Engraved KDP Badge *Each hat is unique and may not have characters on the front or side Unique fit and finish ONE SIZE FITS MOST

name: KDP MASAMUNE 5 PANEL
description: NOW SHIPPING! KDP creates the intangible materials for Hip Hop fans and Artists to arm themselves with when preparing for battle. Like the Samurai, a DJ, B-Boy/B-Girl, Graff Writer, or Emcee must not only have the learned skills and expertise that comes from long hard years of gathering knowledge and practice, but also come equipped with the weapons (records, beats, clothing etc.) to express their skills in an artful manner. It is with this in mind that we present to you our Limited Samurai Series 5-Panel Collection. Three uniquely crafted camper hats, featuring the finest quality imported Japanese fabric—conceptualized and crafted in the USA. Each hat was designed to bolster the presence, confidence and preparedness of the modern Hip Hop warrior, deftly skilled in his or her art: Ima yoshi. Ikou! Like the master sword smiths themselves, these two impeccable pieces of craftsmanship represent the Yin and Yang, the fire and the water, the violence and peace of life: balance. These lids are as sharp as the swords created by their namesakes, cutting the competition like leaves that fall upon the blades crafted by Sensei Muramasa and Sensei Masamune. LIMITED EDITION 24 Units Only (Will never be reissued) Imported Fabric from Japan Black Japanese Armor Visor Silver Stitched Woven Label Adjustable Velcro Strap Custom Engraved KDP Badge Made In USA Unique fit and finish ONE SIZE FITS MOST

name: KDP GOLDEN WARRIOR 5 PANEL
description: NOW SHIPPING! KDP creates the intangible materials for Hip Hop fans and Artists to arm themselves with when preparing for battle. Like the Samurai, a DJ, B-Boy/B-Girl, Graff Writer, or Emcee must not only have the learned skills and expertise that comes from long hard years of gathering knowledge and practice, but also come equipped with the weapons (records, beats, clothing etc.) to express their skills in an artful manner. It is with this in mind that we present to you our Limited Samurai Series 5-Panel Collection. Three uniquely crafted camper hats, featuring the finest quality imported Japanese fabric—conceptualized and crafted in the USA. Each hat was designed to bolster the presence, confidence and preparedness of the modern Hip Hop warrior, deftly skilled in his or her art: Ima yoshi. Ikou! Legend has it that the Golden one, Kintaro—later known as Sakata no Kintoki—did not wear headgear. But if he had, this KDP style "Kabuto" would surely have been his first choice. The mysterious fabric, like Kintaro, is from the wilderness of Mt. Kintoki, designed and woven by a Yama-uba (witch). The material has a mythical strength and the wearer of the object, is temporarily endowed with the attributes of the Japanese mythical warrior known as the “Kogane No Senshi”—or so it is whispered amongst the peasants whom work the land in the foothills of Mt. Kintoki. How KDP has obtained pieces of this fabric is of little importance; rather, we are making it available to you for a limited time in the form of our mystic five panel collection. LIMITED EDITION 24 Units Only (Will never be reissued) Imported Fabric from Japan Black Japanese Armor Visor Silver Stitched Woven Label Adjustable Velcro Strap Custom Engraved KDP Badge Made In USA Unique fit and finish ONE SIZE FITS MOST

name: FORMULATIN' FATHERS LE TAPE
description:
NOW SHIPPING! KicDrum Products and LOST RECORDS, TX exclusive collaborative cassette tape release, Formulatin' Fathers - 'Sleepless Knights'. This underground classic has been resurrected and completely redesigned in cassette tape form, featuring the unique lyrics and beats of both Need Not (Worry) and Drumat!c (KDP)—a Rhode Island / Philadelphia collaboration. If you slept on the 2005 CD, don't sleep on this limited 200 copy release [50 purple / 150 smoke black]! - White imprint – Full Color J-Card - Premium Sticker accent - Exclusive Bonus Content - High Bias Audio Quality All package design by DRUMAT!C for KDP. Tracklist: 01- The Hustler Intro 02- Small Talk 03- October 26th 04- Bulletproof Carhartts 05- Castle Hills and Rooftops 06- Action Reaction 1 (Moment of Clarity) 07- Brighten Up the Son 08- Eyes Like Blue Skies 09- Action Reaction 2 (Stressin' Me) 10- At (K)night They Slept 11- D.E.A.T.H. 12- I Attest# 13- Bulletproof Carharrts (Jae One Remix)#
#UNRELEASED KicDrum Products © 2005-2013 Lost Records © 2013 SHIPS 9.3.13

name: KDP WICKED BLACK HOODIE
description:
If you're out to bomb like Vietnam, throwing up Rustolium and Krylon, or just wanna tag Elephants like Cornbread, stay hooded down and watch that third rail, KDP got your back on the lookout.

Introducing our first long sleeve premium quality sweatshirt, ‘KDP Wicked Black Hoody’. Our KicDrum robot logo graphic is on the back accompanied by the infamous ‘Stay True’ text. Printed along the right sleeve is a Philly wicked hand style of ‘KicDrum Products’—designed by an underground Philly graffiti artist. Fine details include: KDP woven patch with a small KDP woven tag sewn around the right side of the hood.

Only 24 limited for this first edition! Designed in Philly and made in USA.

Features:
-80% cotton/20% polyester fleece
-9.5-oz.
-black and grey plaid flannel-lined hood
-1/4 metal zipper
-raw edge fabric seams
-front pouch pocket

Our KicDrum Products hoodies are designed in Philly, fabricated and printed by hand. As a result, no two items are exactly the same. When you buy a KicDrum hand crafted garment, you are purchasing a unique product that contains top quality care only KDP can provide.

name: THE OFFICIAL SP-1200 BOOK 1.2
description:
"SP1200: The Art And The Science"—also known as THE OFFICIAL SP-1200 BOOK—is the first book of its kind, developed, designed and written to honor the inimitable E-mu SP-1200, hip-hop's most iconic drum machine/sampler. Certified by E-mu Systems, this book celebrates 40 years of the SP-1200. "In the chapters to come, PBODY will guide you through the world of the SP1200, its history, its underlying technology, and both conventional and unconventional techniques for making music with it. I am personally honored to have played a key role in creating such a time-honored instrument, and I must confess how delightful it has been to have a chance to pour over the schematics again and recall the whole design experience. I hope you'll have as much fun reading as I and the whole E-mu gang did in producing the SP1200. Enjoy!" —Dave Rossum, E-Mu Systems Inc. Founder PRODUCED BY TEAM KDP BOOK DESIGN BY COLLIN VENUTO AUTHORED BY SIMON PBODY Exclusive Interviews with: • Buckwild • Dela • DJ I-Cue • DJ Jazzy Jeff • DJ Joc Max • DJ Roddy Rod • DJ Spinna • E-Swift • Easy Mo Bee • Gensu Dean • Grap Luva (Pete Rock's Brother) • Imhotep • Insight • J.Force • J-Zone • Jamey Staub (Pete Rock's Sound Engineer) • Jel • J-Ro • Kdef • Kenny Parker • Lewis Parker • Lord Finesse • Mac Mccraw • Nick Wiz • Showbiz • Ski Beatz • Todd Terry And More... *Ships USPS Priority w/ Delivery Confirmation!! -ONLY 1 AVAILABLE / ULTRA RARE!!!
-OUT OF PRINT ORIGINAL / ONLY 150 PRINTED
-VERSION 1.2
-PRIVATE REVIEW COPY
-8"x8" / 270 PAGES / FULL COLOR
-INCLUDES ORIGINAL PETE ROCK STICKER

name: FORMULATIN' FATHERS 'SLEEPLESS KNIGHTS'
description: MC Need Not (formerly Need Not Worry) & producer Drumat!c combine to form Formulatin' Fathers. This album carefully retells the story of one person's entire life, from childhood to adulthood to death. Expressed over raw, yet wonderfully gritty and dramatic beats, this tale is one you won't want to miss. Format: CD (glass mastered) Original Qty: 500 Released: September 7th, 2005 © KicDrum Products, LLC Lyrics: Need Not Worry Beats/Cuts: Drumat!c Additional Production: Oct. 26th by Swifter OUT OF PRINT SEALED COPY ULTRA RARE MADE IN USA Akai MPC-60II / S-950 E-mu SP-1200 / SP-12 Turbo The Hustler Intro 2:00 Small Talk 3:00 October 26th 4:12 Bulletproof Carhartts 3:01 Castle Hills and Rooftops 3:30 Action Reaction 1 (Moment of Clarity) 2:24 Brighten Up the Son 3:52 Eyes Like Blue Skies 3:44 Action Reaction 2 (Stressin' Me) 2:16 At (K)night They Slept 3:11 D.E.A.T.H. 4:20

name: DRUMZ AND LLINGO 'BLAKMARKET'
description:
At a time when more Hip Hop artists than ever before can be heard on the radio and seen on television, and everyday new artists spring to life in the bedroom of their parents house, huddled next to their brand new laptop and Mp3 components, DRUMAT!C and LLINGO APT - the duo affectionately called DRUMZ & LLINGO - provide a sound remarkably distinct, immediately separating them from the most recent of both underground and commercial Hip Hop album releases. 'BlakMarket', the duo's first full length LP, mixes the gritty sounds of the North East corridor (ala DITC) with the melodic, heavy bass laden sound reminiscent of the Dirty South's Organized Noize, all while supplied by their "weapon of choice" the E-MU SP1200. LLINGO APT - the duo's emcee and front man - provides a style quite versatile and unique as he paints the brains of listeners with images from topics as complex as imperialism and colonialization of the mind, to stories detailing after school "Friday Night" escapades; all the way to a step-by-step instructional about "making a beat." Flow as well as production is woven seamlessly as LLINGO spins from topic to topic, keeping your brain as well as your feet moving. The supporting cast of exquisite emcees hailing from New York, Rhode Island and Philadelphia peppered throughout the album, act as palate cleansers, preparing the listener for each new dish cooked and served by the beat smith duo - sure to be feeding fans ear holes with organic analog meals for years to come.

Format: CD
Original Qty: 200
Released: December 12th, 2008
© KicDrum Products, LLC

Lyrics: Llingo Apt
Beats/Cuts: Drumz and Llingo
Mixed/Recorded: South Philadelphia, PA

Features: Dface, Doam, Calamity Chris, NeedNotWorry, Bamboo, Wise Dome, Ikan

OUT OF PRINT
SEALED COPY
ULTRA RARE
MADE IN USA
E-mu SP-1200 / EMAX 1

name: E-mu SP-1200 FLASH DRIVE 16GB
description:
Introducing, the worlds first USB flash memory drive shaped like the E-Mu SP-1200. It's Hip-Hop's grittiest 12-Bit drum machine / sampler. This is the long time favorite sampler of producers such as Pete Rock, Easy Mo Bee, Buckwild, Large Professor and more! The SP-1200 drum machine has been immortalized as a 16 GB USB flash memory drive. Every nuance of the E-Mu Classic has been captured in extreme detail! These unique devices are perfect for Hip-Hop beat makers, producers, and enthusiast on the go.

Technical Specificatons:
• 16 GB Capacity
• Hight Quality Toshiba Flash Memory
• Ultra High Detail
• Super Durable PVC Rubber Construction
• USB 2.0 Support

Uses:
• Drum and Sound Storage
• Pro-Tools / Tracked out Audio Sessions
• Beat CD's - Catch A&R Attention
• Music, MP3, and Data Storage
• Store your Beats

SHIPS APRIL/MAY 2013

name: KDP + JIM MAHFOOD TEE GREY
description: Jim Mahfood aka Food One is one of the most dynamic and talented artists of his generation. As a freelance artist, Jim has done professional work in fields including illustration, comics, murals, animation, advertising and fine art. His work has appeared in Playboy, Spin and Madd Magazine and has worked with every major comic book company in the world. His resume also includes complete art for the new Tank Girl graphic novel out now, custom car art for the new Nissan Juke, Illustrating Kevin Smiths “Clerks” comics, and art directing Ziggy Marley’s “Marijuana Man.” Now KDP can proudly proclaim that Food One has supplied us with a one of a kind limited edition T-shirt illustration. The Food One design pays homage to the art of hip-hop production in this latest KicDrum tee. A funky drummer centers the shirt with the classic SP-1200 plugged into the set by his side. Behind the drummer stands an emcee with a mic in his paw and a ghetto blaster on his shoulder and a female bearing a tambourine dominates the foreground. Like all KDP tees the Food One shirt is made for hip-hop heads by hip-hop heads, yet is accessible for all lovers of art, illustration, comics, or music in general. The KDP Food One tee is available in classic white, heather grey and red 100% cotton tees. All KicDrum Product tees are designed in Philly, hand pressed and our tags are hand sewn. As a result, no two Tees are exactly the same. When you buy a KicDrum hand crafted garment, you are purchasing a unique product that contains top quality care only KDP can provide. For more Food One Art check out www.jimmahfood.com ILLUSTRATION BY JIM MAHFOOD DESIGN BY DRUMAT!C PRINTED IN U.S.A. SHIPS LATE SEPTEMBER 2012 24 Limited Pressings SIZE SPECS

name: KDP ‘92 TEAM USA TEE NAVY
description: In 1992 Street Fighter II was rated game of the year, Nirvana was the top rock band in the U.S, Gang Starr released Daily Operation, Wu-Tang Clan was born, Clinton defeated Bush in the presidential election, and the Redskins beat the Bills in the Super Bowl. But so what? The only thing everyone was doing in the summer of 1992 besides playing Street Fighter II and listening to the Chronic, was watching the US Olympic men’s basketball team, the greatest team ever assembled, run through the Olympics like a Masamune blade. The KDP Dream Team tee pays all respect due to the 92’ Dream Team with this new authentic hip-hop tee. This is a replica tee designed after the Dream Team jersey with the number 92 to represent the year of their Olympic gold win and also one of the greatest years in hip-hop music. We have replaced USA with KDP, made the basketball inside the star into a record and removed the word basketball, inserting “authentic hip hop” in its place. Whether you need a shirt to go with those new Olympic Jordan’s, loved the Dream Team, or are just a fan of dope hip-hop gear, this tee is for you. All KicDrum Product tees are designed in Philly, hand pressed and our tags are hand sewn. As a result no two Tees are exactly the same. When you buy a KicDrum hand crafted garment, you are purchasing a unique product that contains top quality care only KDP can provide. CONCEPT BY DFACE DESIGN BY DRUMAT!C PRINTED IN U.S.A. SHIPS LATE SEPTEMBER 2012 24 Limited Pressings SIZE SPECS

name: KDP JAYDEE MPC 3000
description: RIP Dilla. Representing the Akai MPC 3000, Jay Dilla continues to have an influence in the Hip Hop production community even after the event of his passing. Shown with his trusty MPC 3000, Dilla changed the way beat makers approached the creation of a drum pattern and spurred new sounds that reached Rock and R&B as well as Hip Hop. Hand designed, pressed, and fitted with double neck stitching to prevent stretching and wear, these 100% organic T-Shirts are both light and durable, comfortable and fly. Brett Baker -- JAY-Z's percussionist/producer reppin' KicDrum Products JAYDEE remix tee. name: TIC-TAC-TOE  7" VINYL 003
description:
Noughts and crosses. The roundness of the drum meets the crossing of the stick. The flame from the match ignites the BOOM from the wick. Drumz & Llingo’s Philly sound meets a New York trio with unmatched wits. KDP proudly introduces, Lewis Parker: UK native, SP technician, emcee extraordinaire with the golden sound. T.R.A.C: Flow artisan, boom bap blesser and Koncrete Jungle repper. John Robinson: The Linguistic surgeon, operating with scientific precision. Individually dynamic and collectively triumphant, John Robinson, TRAC and Lewis Parker display a unique ability to come together and murder an absolutely meddlesome beat. The emcees provide unique and different styles while at the same time maintaining a cohesion rarely seen by actual multiple emcee rap groups. While not a group themselves, these individually accomplished emcees, have worked together in the past. Yet it is worthy to note that John Robinson, (previously known as Lil’ Sci from Scienz of Life) is reuniting with Lewis parker for the first time since their successful International Summers colab in 2010. The A side of this record is as hard as it gets. Drumz & Llingo continue to define the modern rugged east coast sound, and also show producers what a remix should sound like; via a B side that sounds like an entirely different song, that is equally as good as the original, but flipped on its head with a totally different feel. Learn from this. This is what a remix should be. KDP strikes gold again, this time with the help of Lewis Parker, TRAC and John Robinson. Tic-Tac-Toe that's three in a row... lets go Game over. TIC-TAC-TOE - Vocal feat. Lewis Parker, T.R.A.C., and John Robinson KDP-7-LTJ-TT-003 A-SIDE: VOCAL B-SIDE: REMIX ® 2012 - 2013 KicDrum Products, LLC Written by Lewis Parker, T.R.A.C., and John Robinson Produced by Drumz and Llingo Recorded by Drumz and Llingo at the Bomb Shelter Mixed by DFACE at the Dirty Labs Studio, NY Mastered by LEWIS PARKER for World of Dusty Vinyl Limited 7" Vinyl KicDrum Products KDP distribution, Philly USA 300 SERIALIZED COPIES 1-100 Silver-Gray vinyl 101-300 Black vinyl Silver Metallic Ink 18pt. Black Paper Jacket 100% Recycled Silver Seven Series™
Digital Download

name: JON QUEST 7" VINYL 002
description:
Drumz & Llingo’s production goes turnpike for this East/West Pennsylvania collaboration. The KicDrum Products beat team known for their unique SP-1200 production and hard, grimy underground sound, solidified their fast growing reputation as Philly’s go-to-production-duo on KDP’s latest Silver Seven Series™ release “Bar Buryin”,featuring two of Pittsburgh’s finest Jon Quest and Hubbs. With terribly mean bass and drums that hit harder than a Mike Tyson hook, Llingo and Drumat!c have created a beat that is a legitimate head-banger, and could be the roughest track of the year. The Philly duo is consistent in their rugged approach to beat making and Bar Buryin’ does nothing but exemplify both their sound and style. Perfectly complimenting the Drumz & Llingo instrumental are the talented Pittsburgh emcees, Jon Quest and Hubbs. Hubbs starts off the track with a calm and stern flow that reflects his mid 90’s influences that include Biggie, Nas, Jay-Z, Wu-Tang and others, yet the style is all his own. Rapping clean up is Jon Quest. From P.H. he graduated, and was also nominated for Best Lyricist and Underground Artist during the 2009 Pittsburgh Hip Hop awards. Jon Quest has quickly made a name for himself and uniting with KDP has never sounded better. Perfectly in command, Jon Quest demands your attention; and you will give it because the production is amazing and the rap is top notch bar burying. *Artwork subject to change. SIDE A: VOCAL SIDE B: INSTRUMENTAL PRODUCED BY DRUMZ AND LLINGO MIXED BY DFACE MASTERED BY LEWIS PARKER 200 Limited Pressings Total Silver Center Labels Silver Metallic Ink 18pt. name: WALT SICKNIN’ 7” VINYL 001
description: Walt Sicknin’ is his name. Hunting Park, North Philadelphia flows through his veins. A grown man’s rapper…Walt is an emcee. With lyrical vengeance that strikes harder than the hammer of John Henry. His prowess and storytelling ability rival no one. Walt Sicknin’ is a street legend; a North Philadelphia myth since rhyming in Olney High lunch room back in ‘92, striking fear in the hearts of local emcees who dared to step. The myth of Walt Sicknin grew for nearly ten years before emerging from the concrete of Broad Street, seeking refuge in the hard, gritty music of Drumz and Llingo. Now equipped with an ultra-rugged sound that demands respect, Walt is out to take it. We present to you for the first time, Walt Sicknin’—The greatest Philly rapper you’ve never heard.
